<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10.1&nbsp;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"></SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(b)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;
</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">35.8</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11.4&nbsp;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"></SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(b)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(a)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Segment revenue as a percentage of total revenue from continuing operations. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(b)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Segment profit before tax as a percentage of total profit before tax from continuing operations. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Revenue </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Between 2006
and early 2009 Subsea 7 participated in a joint venture arrangement in Asia Pacific with Technip. Under this arrangement, projects were undertaken through a mix of unincorporated and incorporated joint ventures. In early 2009, Subsea 7 and Technip
announced their intention to dissolve their joint venture arrangement once all existing projects and tendered work had been completed. In addition to the joint venture activity in the region, there was also some activity that was contracted directly
with Subsea 7. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The way in which projects are contracted has an effect on the way in which they are accounted for. Work that was contracted
through incorporated joint ventures are accounted for using the &#145;equity method&#146; which means that </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">114 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
Subsea 7 only reports the share of post-tax profits from the joint venture, with no associated revenue. Given the different number of projects that were equity accounted for during the periods,
meaningful comparisons of revenue in the Asia Pacific region are difficult to produce. As a result, profit before tax tends to be a better indicator of the level of activity in this region. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Asia Pacific segment revenue increased to $137.2 million in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010, compared to revenue of $24.5 million in the six
months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. The main driver of the revenue in Asia Pacific was Subsea Field Projects, which generated $117.0 million, or 85.3% of the Asia Pacific revenue in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010, compared to $12.1 million, or
49.4% in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. The major reason for this increase in revenue between these periods was the fact that during early 2010, the Santos Henry and Murphy Kikeh projects were completed in the region and this was included
in revenue rather than equity accounted for. There was no Life-of-Field activity undertaken in Asia Pacific in either the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 or June&nbsp;30, 2009. The revenue in Asia Pacific generated from i-Tech activities was
$20.1 million, or 14.7% of total Asia Pacific revenue in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010, compared to $12.4 million, or 50.6% of total Asia Pacific revenue in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 the Asia Pacific segment revenue increased 66.6% to $122.3 million, compared to revenue of $73.4 million in
the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008. The majority of the revenue in Asia Pacific was from Subsea Field Projects, which generated $92.4 million or 75.6% of total Asia Pacific revenue in 2009, compared to $40.2 million, or 54.8% in 2008. As
previously mentioned the main reason for the increase in revenue was work performed on Santos&#146; Henry and Murphy&#146;s Kikeh projects during late 2009. The revenue generated by the i-Tech business decreased to $29.9 million or 24.4% of total
Asia Pacific revenue in 2009, from $33.2 million, or 45.2% in 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 the Asia Pacific segment
revenue decreased 56.2% to $73.4 million, compared to revenue of $167.4 million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007. The main contributor of the revenue in Asia Pacific was Subsea Field Projects, which generated $40.2 million or 54.8% of total
Asia Pacific revenue in 2008, compared to $137.7 million, or 82.3% in 2007. The main reason for this difference was fact that an increased number of projects in 2008 were accounted for using the equity method, and therefore profits for these
projects were reported, but the related revenue was not separately reported. There was no revenue generated by the Life-of-Field business in either the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 or 2007. The revenue generated by the i-Tech business
increased to $33.2 million or 45.2% of total Asia Pacific revenue in 2008, from $29.7 million, or 17.7% in 2007. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Profit
before tax </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Asia Pacific segment profit before tax was $45.9 million in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010, compared to a loss
before tax of $6.1 million in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. The 2009 losses predominantly reflected lower activity levels and a 78 day dry-docking relating to <I>Rockwater 2</I>, compared to no dry-docking in 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 the Asia Pacific segment profit before tax decreased 62.4% to $15.0 million, compared to profit before tax
of $39.9 million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008. The decrease in profit before tax between 2008 and 2009 predominantly related to a lower volume of activity for Woodside in Australia during 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 the Asia Pacific segment profit before tax increased 11.5% to $39.9 million in the year ended December&nbsp;31,
2008, compared to profit before tax of $35.8 million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007. The increase in profit before tax between 2007 and 2008 mainly related to a higher volume of activity for Woodside in Australia during 2008. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">115 </FONT></P>

<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(66.0</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">)&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(27.9</FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">)&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">n/a&nbsp;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"></SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(b)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(a)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Segment revenue as a percentage of total revenue from continuing operations. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(b)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Segment profit before tax as a percentage of total profit before tax from continuing operations. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Global segment loss before tax was $66.0 million in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010, compared to a loss before tax of $8.4 million in the six
months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. The most significant contributor to this significant change was an expense of $18.9 million during the 6 months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 relating to the changes in fair value of derivative financial instruments
compared to an income of $35.1 million during the equivalent period in 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 the Global segment
loss before tax was $20.7 million, compared to a loss before tax of $64.8 million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008. Changes in fair value of derivative financial instruments contributed income of $47.7 million during 2009 compared to an
expense of $34.1 million during 2008. This was partially offset by an increase in finance expense from $33.0 million in 2008 to $60.0 million in 2009. This reflected accelerated accretion during 2009 relating to Subsea 7&#146;s 2007 convertible
notes after re-assessment of their accretion period. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 the Global segment loss before tax increased
to $64.8 million, compared to a loss before tax of $27.9 million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007. The increase was primarily due to a loss of $22.2 million being recorded in 2008 on the marking-to-market of available-for-sale assets
acquired by Subsea 7 during 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>11.5 Off-balance sheet arrangements </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Historically, Subsea 7 has not used special-purpose vehicles or similar financing arrangements. In addition, there are no off-balance sheet arrangements
with any of Subsea 7&#146;s affiliates or with any unconsolidated entities. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.5.1 Leases and bank guarantees </I></B>
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subsea 7 engages in operating leases in the normal course of business in respect of vessel charter hire obligations, office facilities and
equipment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subsea 7 also arranges for bank guarantees, which collectively refer to performance bonds, bid bonds, advance payment bonds,
guarantees or standby letters of credit in respect of performance obligations to clients in connection with work on specific projects. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">116 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The purpose of the bank guarantees is generally to enable clients to recover cash advances paid to Subsea 7
under the project contracts or to obtain cash compensation should Subsea 7 be unable to fulfil performance obligations under contracts. Bank guarantees issued in first half of 2010 for support of projects was $13.4 million (first half of fiscal
2009: $32.4 million; 2009: $58.1 million; 2008: $87.7 million). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B></B>For further details of Subsea 7&#146;s guarantee facilities, see the
&#145;<B></B><I>XII. Capitalisation and Indebtedness</I><B></B>&#146; section of this prospectus.<B> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.5.2 Legal
matters </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In May 2009 Subsea 7&#146;s Brazilian business was subject to a Federal Revenue Tax Inspection which determined that
umbilicals carried on board the vessel <I>Seven Oceans</I> should have been declared as cargo as opposed to vessel. Subsea 7 subsequently challenged this assessment and a first review decision was issued on 21&nbsp;December 2009 declaring the
Federal Revenue Inspection tax assessment was invalid. The Federal Revenue Inspection has lodged an appeal which is pending. The original assessment claim was for BRL129.0 million ($72.5 million). As at June&nbsp;30, 2010, the amount of the claim
including accrued interest was BRL140.7 million ($79.1 million). No provision has been made for any payment as Subsea 7 does not believe that this liability is probable. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In June 2010, Subsea 7 (Vessel Company) Limited received a claim letter on behalf of Hydrodive International Limited relating to the sale of the vessel
<I>Kommander Subsea 2000</I> in 2007. The letter claimed misrepresentation with regard to the condition of the vessel upon sale. The amount of the claim currently stands at $18.6 million. Subsea 7 is currently reviewing the claim with its advisors.
No provision has been made for payment in respect of the claim </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">From time-to-time, Subsea 7 becomes involved in contract disputes due to the
nature of its activities as contracting business, involved in several long-term projects at any given time. Subsea 7 takes provisions to cover the expected risk of loss to the extent that negative outcomes are likely and reliable estimates can be
made. However, the final outcomes of these contract disputes are subject to uncertainties as to whether or not they develop into a formal legal action and therefore the resulting liabilities may exceed the liability it anticipated. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Furthermore, Subsea 7 is involved in legal proceedings from time to time incidental to the ordinary conduct of its business. Litigation is subject to
many uncertainties, and the outcome of individual matters is not predictable with assurance. It is reasonably possible that the final resolution of any litigation could require Subsea 7 to make additional expenditures in excess of reserves that
Subsea 7 may establish. In the ordinary course of business, various claims, suits and complaints have been filed against us in addition to those specifically referred to above. Although the final resolution of any such other matters could have a
material effect on operating results for a particular reporting period, Subsea 7 believes that they should not materially affect its consolidated financial position. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.5.3 Changes in share capital </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The total authorised number of ordinary shares is 300,000,000 shares with a par value of $0.01 per share. All issued shares are fully paid. Subsea 7 Inc.
had 147,239,880 shares issued and outstanding at June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In January 2008, Subsea 7 Inc. repurchased 890,000 of its own shares at
an average price of NOK 98.04&nbsp;per share (equivalent to $17.66 per share). These shares have been cancelled and form part of the authorised but un-issued share capital. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.5.4 Capital commitments </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As at June&nbsp;30, 2010, there were contracts placed for future capital expenditure of $135.9 million. These were not provided for in the financial
statements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">117 </FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of June&nbsp;30, 2010, Subsea 7&#146;s contractual cash obligations by future period were as follows: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="9" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><B>(</B><B><I>$ millions</I></B><B>)</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Long-term debt

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(a)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>This includes Subsea 7&#146;s convertible loan notes. Convertible loan notes are assumed to be repaid in full at maturity. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(b)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Subsea 7&#146;s debt structure currently contains fixed interest rate debt, and therefore it has calculated the amount of the future interest payments based on the
2.8% interest rate on the $249 million outstanding aggregate principal amount of the $300 million convertible loan notes and the 3.5% interest rate on the $275 million outstanding aggregate principal amount of the $275 million convertible loan note.
For further details see Note 25 &#145;Borrowings&#146; to the 2009 consolidated financial statements. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(c)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Subsea 7 has entered into a number of vessel charters and also has various plant and equipment including ROVs and motor vehicles under non-cancellable operating
lease agreements. Subsea 7 also leases offices, warehouses and other work sites. The leases have various terms, escalation clauses and renewal rights. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.5.6 Contingent obligations </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subsea 7 is party to indemnities, legal actions and claims that arise in the ordinary course of business. While the outcome of such legal proceedings
cannot be readily foreseen, management believes that they will be resolved without material effect on Subsea 7&#146;s results, financial position or liquidity. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>11.6 Liquidity and Capital Resources </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.6.1 Cash management </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subsea 7&#146;s sources of liquidity are cash generated from operations, revolving credit facilities provided by major financial institutions and
long-term convertible notes that have been issued. Cash generated from operations continues to be the primary source of funds to finance operating needs, capital expenditures and debt service. Subsea 7 had cash and cash equivalents of $455.6 million
as at June&nbsp;30, 2010, compared to $84.8 million at June&nbsp;30, 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.6.2 Summary cash flows

<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>167.7</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1px">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.6.3 Cash flows from operating activities </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Net cash from operating activities generated during the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 was $15.4 million, compared to $93.2 million for the six
months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. The decrease in operating cash flow </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">118 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
performance in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 principally reflects the decrease of cash generated from operations of $89.6 million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 compared to
$154.6 million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. The decrease in cash generated from operations mainly reflects the lower year-on-year activity levels and the decrease in net profit. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 net cash from operating activities generated was $541.6 million, compared to $471.1 million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2008. The increase in operating cash flows principally reflects an increase of cash generated from operations of $640.0 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, compared to $590.4 million for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2008. The increase in cash generated from operations benefited from a decrease in working capital balances year-on-year. Taxation paid during the year reduced to $91.0 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, compared to
$115.0 million during 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 net cash from operating activities generated was $471.1 million,
compared to $288.0 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007. The significant increase in operating cash flows was due to an increase of cash generated from operations of $590.4 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008, compared to
$323.8 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007. The main reasons for the increase in cash generated from operations were an increase in net profit, and improved cash flows from movements in working capital balances year-on-year. Taxation
paid during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 increased to $115.0 million, compared to $35.6 million during 2007, this reflected taxes paid in relation to the year-on-year increase in profit before tax. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.6.4 Cash flows from investing activities </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Net cash from investing activities in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 was $113.1 million compared to net cash used of $108.0 million for the six
months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. In the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010, this primarily comprised net cash outflows related to the purchase of property, plant and equipment of $59.4 million to further develop the Subsea 7&#146;s asset base
compared to purchases of property, plant and equipment of $115.8 in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. One of the major differences between these two periods was that during 2008 there were payments related to the <I>Seven Seas</I> vessel,
which joined the fleet in the second quarter of 2008. This decrease in net cash outflows between 2009 and 2010 was also attributable to the fact that in the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010, Subsea 7 sold available-for-sale financial assets of
$173.0 million, being shares, ADSs and convertible notes in Acergy S.A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 net cash used by investing
activities was $228.6 million compared to net cash used of $602.6 million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008. In the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, this primarily comprised net cash outflows related to the purchase of property, plant and
equipment of $246.3 million, compared to purchases of property, plant and equipment of $449.3 in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008. During 2009 significant payments were made relating to the construction of the <I>Seven Pacific</I> and <I>Seven
Atlantic</I> vessels. During 2008 Subsea 7 acquired available-for-sale assets for $179.4 million, these represented shares, ADSs and convertible notes in Acergy S.A. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 net cash used by investing activities was $602.6 million compared to net cash used of $381.0 million for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007. In the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007, this primarily comprised net cash outflows related to the purchase of property, plant and equipment of $449.3 million, compared to purchases of property, plant and
equipment of $383.7 in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007. During 2008 significant payments were made relating to the construction of the <I>Seven Seas</I> and <I>Seven Atlantic</I> vessels. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007 payments were
made towards the construction of the <I>Seven Oceans</I>, <I>Seven Seas</I> and <I>Seven Atlantic</I> vessels. As discussed previously, during 2008 Subsea 7 acquired available-for-sale assets for $179.4 million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.6.5 Cash flows from financing activities </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 net cash used in financing activities was $144.5 million, compared to net cash used of $11.0 million in the six
months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. This increase in cash used in financing activities was attributable to the redemption of convertible loan notes of $134.9 million with no equivalent item in 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 net cash from financing activities was $47.8 million, compared to net cash from financing activities of $124.9
million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008. The main items in the year </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">119 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 were net proceeds from the issue of convertible notes of $272.9 million, the repurchase of convertible notes of $75.5 million and repayment of loans of $150.0
million. During 2008, net cash from financing activities comprised the drawdown of $150.0 million of loans, and the repurchase of Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s shares of $15.7 million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008 net cash from financing activities was $124.9 million, compared to net cash from financing activities of
$177.1 million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2007. As previously discussed net cash from financing activities comprised the drawdown of $150.0 million of loans, and the repurchase of Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s shares of $15.7 million. During 2007,
net cash from financing activities was mainly related to the proceeds from the issue of convertible notes of $175.0 million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.6.6 Description of indebtedness </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For details of Subsea 7&#146;s indebtedness, see section &#145;<I>XII. Capitalisation and Indebtedness</I>&#146; of this prospectus. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>11.6.7 Trading Outlook </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subsea 7&#146;s strong performance for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 was supported by good project execution in all regions, including the
successful completion of several significant projects such as Santos&#146; Henry and Murphy&#146;s Kikeh projects in Asia Pacific and Petrobras&#146; Sul Capixaba project in Brazil. The award of several new projects during the first half of 2010,
including the award of the largest single contract to Subsea 7&#146;s i-Tech business by Petrobras in Brazil with an estimated contract value of $250 million with potential for up to $405 million, is encouraging. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Since June&nbsp;30, 2010, Subsea 7 has been awarded a contract from Petrobras to provide ROV and under water positioning survey services, offshore
Brazil, valued in the region of $50 million. Subsea 7 was also awarded a contract to engineer, fabricate and install a pipeline bundle in the North Sea. The contract is valued in excess of $100 million. Tendering activity remains high in all regions
and the outlook for the medium to long-term remains positive. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>11.7 Significant changes to the Consolidated Financial Information
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">There have been no significant changes to the financial position of Subsea 7 since June 30, 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">120 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc59275_12"></A>XII. CAPITALISATION AND INDEBTEDNESS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following tables set out the capitalisation and indebtedness of Acergy, as at May&nbsp;31, 2010 and Subsea 7, as at June&nbsp;30, 2010, on a
standalone basis and of the Combined Group on a pro forma basis as if the Combination had become effective as at May&nbsp;31, 2010. The information in the following tables has been extracted without material adjustment from the unaudited interim
consolidated financial statements of Acergy and Subsea 7 as at May&nbsp;31, 2010 (&#145;Unaudited Acergy interim balance sheet extract 2010&#146;) and June&nbsp;30, 2010 (&#145;Unaudited Subsea 7 interim balance sheet extract 2010&#146;)
respectively. The unaudited pro forma consolidated financial information (&#145;Unaudited Pro forma interim balance sheet extract 2010&#146;) has been extracted from unaudited pro forma condensed consolidated balance sheet as at May&nbsp;31, 2010.
Further information regarding the pro forma adjustments can be found in &#145;<I>XIV. Unaudited Pro Forma Condensed Consolidated Financial Information of SUBSEA 7 S.A. as of and for the six months ended May&nbsp;31, 2010</I>&#146;. </FONT></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#151;</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><U>Notes</U></I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I></I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(a)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>On July&nbsp;23, 2009, Acergy entered into a sale agreement to dispose of 19% of its ownership interest in Sonamet Industrial, S.A. (&#145;Sonamet&#146;), with
completion of this sale expected to occur in 2010. As the disposal will result in Acergy reducing its ownership in Sonamet from 55% to 36% the assets and liabilities of Sonamet, including its net financial indebtedness, have been classified as
&#145;Assets held for sale&#146; and are therefore excluded from the tables of capitalisation and indebtedness (see below). As at May&nbsp;31, 2010 the current debt and non-current debt attributable to Sonamet was $4.8 million and $15.6 million
respectively. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(b)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Acergy debt relates solely to the $500 million 2.25% convertible loan notes due 2013 &#151; see &#145;12.3 Description of Acergy&#146;s Indebtedness&#146; below for
further details. As outlined in Acergy&#146;s accounting policies in its 2009 Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements, the convertible loan note, including its accrued transaction costs is accounted for using both a liability and an equity
component. As at May&nbsp;31, 2010, the liability component of the convertible loan note was $425.2 million and the equity component was $110.7 million. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(c)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Subsea 7 debt relates solely to the outstanding balances on the $300 million 2.80% convertible loan notes due 2011, $175 million zero coupon
convertible loan notes due 2017 and $275 million 3.50% convertible loan notes due 2014 &#151; see &#145;12.4 Description of Subsea 7&#146;s Indebtedness&#146; below for further details. As outlined in Subsea 7&#146;s accounting policies in its 2009
Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements, the convertible loan notes, including their respective accrued transaction costs are accounted for using both a </I></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">121 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>
liability and an equity component. As at June&nbsp;30, 2010, the liability components of the $300 million 2.80% convertible loan notes due 2011, $175 million zero coupon convertible loan notes
due 2017 and $275 million 3.50% convertible loan notes due 2014 were $238.7 million, $3.1 million and $229.6 million respectively. The equity components of the $300 million 2.80% convertible loan notes due 2011, $175 million zero coupon convertible
loan notes due 2017 and $275 million 3.50% convertible loan notes due 2014 were $52.5 million, $0.9 million and $51.8 million respectively. </I></FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(d)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Acergy and Subsea 7 security and guarantees are described further in the &#145;12.3 Description of Acergy&#146;s Indebtedness&#146; and &#145;12.4 Description of
Subsea 7&#146;s Indebtedness&#146; sections below. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(e)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Subsea 7&#146;s facilities have security over certain assets (see &#145;12.4 Description of Subsea 7&#146;s Indebtedness&#146; below for details). There was nil cash
drawing on any of these facilities as at June&nbsp;30, 2010. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>12.2 Indebtedness </B></FONT></P>
