<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Non-current financial indebtedness</I></B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>425.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>232.7</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&#151;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>657.9</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1px">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I></I></B><B>Net financial indebtedne</B><B><I>ss /
(cash)<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex"> (b)</SUP></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></I></B></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(206.0</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>)&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(0.4</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>)&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>16.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(190.2</B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>)&nbsp;</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1px">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><U>Notes</U></I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I></I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(a)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Total current financial debt less liquidity. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(b)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Total non-current financial indebtedness less excess of total liquidity over total current financial debt. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(c)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>As noted in the Capitalisation table above, Acergy net financial indebtedness excludes Sonamet which has been classified as &#145;Assets held for sale&#146;. As at
May&nbsp;31, 2010 cash and cash equivalents, current financial debt and non-current financial debt attributable to Sonamet was $86.8 million, $4.8 million and $15.5 million respectively. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(d)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Acergy holds restricted cash balances which comprise funds held in a separate bank account which will be used to settle accrued taxation liabilities and deposits
made by Acergy as security for certain third-party obligations. Such restricted cash balances are excluded from net financial indebtedness. As at May&nbsp;31, 2010 restricted cash balance amounted to $34.8 million. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(e)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Acergy non-current financial indebtedness relates solely to the $500 million 2.25% convertible loan notes due 2013 &#151; see &#145;12.3 Description of Acergy&#146;s
Indebtedness&#146; below for further details. As outlined in Acergy&#146;s accounting policies in its 2009 Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements, the convertible loan note, including its accrued transaction costs is accounted for using both
a liability and an equity component. As at May&nbsp;31, 2010, the liability component of the convertible loan note was $425.2 million and the equity component was $110.7 million. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(f)</I></FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Subsea 7 current and non-current financial indebtedness solely to the outstanding balances on the $300 million 2.80% convertible loan notes due 2011, $175 million
zero coupon convertible loan notes due 2017 and $275 million 3.50% convertible loan notes due 2014 &#151; see &#145;12.4 Description of Subsea 7&#146;s Indebtedness&#146; below for further details. As outlined in Subsea 7&#146;s accounting policies
in its 2009 Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements, the convertible loan notes, including their respective accrued transaction costs are accounted for using both a liability and an equity component. As at June&nbsp;30, 2010, the liability
components of the $300 million 2.80% convertible loan notes due 2011, $175 million zero coupon convertible loan notes due 2017 and $275 million 3.50% convertible loan notes due 2014 were $238.7 million, $3.1 million and $229.6 million respectively.
The equity components of the $300 million 2.80% convertible loan notes due 2011, $175 million zero coupon convertible loan notes due 2017 and $275 million 3.50% convertible loan notes due 2014 were $52.5 million, $0.9 million and $51.8 million
respectively. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">122 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.2.1 Acergy &#151; material changes to capitalisation and indebtedness
</I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Since the end of the first six months of the fiscal year 2010, the following material events, outside of the ordinary course of
business, have impacted on Acergy&#146;s capitalisation and indebtedness: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the third quarter of fiscal year 2010, Acergy acquired <I>Antares</I> (a new shallow water barge for the conventional market for pipelay and
hook-up projects in West Africa) and <I>Polar Queen</I> (a flexible pipelay and subsea construction ship which joined the fleet in 2006 on long-term charter); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2010, Acergy acquired <I>Pertinacia </I>(a flexible pipelay ship and key enabling asset, which joined the
fleet in 2007 on long-term charter). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The net effect of these purchases on Acergy&#146;s capitalisation and indebtedness
would be to reduce Acergy&#146;s cash and cash equivalents by approximately $160 million in aggregate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.2.2 Subsea 7
&#151; material changes to capitalisation and indebtedness </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Since the end of the first six months of the fiscal year 2010, the
following material events, outside of the ordinary course of business, have impacted on Subsea 7&#146;s capitalisation and indebtedness: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On August&nbsp;24, 2010 Subsea 7 Inc. purchased $10 million (par value) of the $300 million 2.80% convertible loan notes due 2011 for $9.96 million;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On August&nbsp;26, 2010 Subsea 7 Inc. purchased a further $10 million (par value) of the $300 million 2.80% convertible loan notes due 2011 for $9.96
million. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The net effect of these purchases on Subsea 7&#146;s capitalisation and indebtedness would be to reduce Subsea
7&#146;s cash and cash equivalents by $20.0 million (including $0.1 million accrued interest) and to decrease Subsea 7&#146;s other current financial debt by $19.3 million, with $0.6 million recognised as a finance cost. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>12.3 Description of Acergy&#146;s indebtedness </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.3.1 Cash and cash equivalents </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As at May&nbsp;31, 2010 Acergy held $631.2 million in cash and cash equivalents (excluding $86.8 million in cash and cash equivalents relating to Sonamet
which is classified as an asset held for sale). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.3.2 Convertible loan notes </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>$500 million 2.25% convertible loan notes due 2013 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On October&nbsp;11, 2006 Acergy S.A. issued $500.0 million in aggregate principal amount of its 2.25% convertible loan notes due 2013. The issuance was
completed on October&nbsp;11, 2006 with the receipt of net proceeds after deduction of issuance related costs of $490.8 million. The issuance costs of $9.2 million have been split between the liability and equity components. The convertible loan
notes have an annual interest of 2.25% payable semi-annually in arrears on April&nbsp;11 and October&nbsp;11 of each year up to and including fiscal year 2013. They were issued at 100% of their principal amount and unless previously redeemed,
converted or cancelled will mature on October&nbsp;11, 2013 at 100% of their principal amount. The convertible loan notes are admitted to trading on the Euro MTF Market of the Luxembourg Stock Exchange. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The noteholders were granted an option which allows them to convert the convertible loan notes into shares with an initial conversion price of $24.05 per
share equivalent to 20,790,021 shares, or at the date of issue approximately 10.7% of Acergy S.A.&#146;s issued share capital (excluding treasury shares held as at October&nbsp;11, 2006). All $500.0 million of notes remain outstanding as at
May&nbsp;31, 2010 with a conversion price at that date of $22.71, equivalent to 22,016,733 Shares, or approximately 12.0% of Acergy S.A.&#146;s issued share capital (excluding treasury shares) at that date. Following the payment of the $0.23 per
share Acergy S.A. dividend on June&nbsp;18, 2010, for holders of Shares and June&nbsp;23, 2010 for holders of Acergy ADSs, the conversion price was revised to $22.37 per share as per the terms and conditions of the convertible loan note. At this
revised conversion price, the $500.0 million of notes outstanding are equivalent to 22,351,363 Shares, or approximately 12.1% of Acergy S.A.&#146;s issued share capital (excluding treasury shares) as of May&nbsp;31, 2010. The conversion price will
continue to be adjusted in line with its terms and conditions including in case of payment of dividends. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If and when the Combination becomes
effective, there will be no change to the terms of these notes. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">123 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.3.3 Credit and guarantee facilities </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The $400 million amended and restated revolving credit and guarantee facility (the &#145;$400 million facility&#146;) </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As at May&nbsp;31, 2010, the $400 million facility, dated August&nbsp;10, 2006 comprised $300 million available for the issuance of guarantees and $75
million available for cash drawings. To the extent that no loans are drawn under the amount available for cash drawings, this part of the facility was able to be utilised for guarantee issuance. The final date of maturity of the facility was
August&nbsp;10, 2011 and the maturity date of guarantees were required to be prior to February&nbsp;10, 2013. This facility was guaranteed by an Acergy S.A. guarantee only. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As at May&nbsp;31, 2010 under this $400 million facility, Acergy had utilised $142 million of the $300 million available for guarantee issuance and had
not utilised any of the $75 million available for cash drawings. No drawdowns of cash under this facility were made in the fiscal year 2009 or first half fiscal year 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On August&nbsp;10, 2010 Acergy S.A. executed a $1.0 billion multi-currency revolving credit and guarantee facility with a number of banks. As part of the
terms of this agreement, the $400 million facility was cancelled and any amounts utilised on the execution date were transferred to the $1.0 billion facility, as described below. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The $200 million multi-currency revolving guarantee facility (the &#145;$200 million facility&#146;) </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On February&nbsp;26, 2008, Acergy executed a $200 million multi-currency revolving guarantee facility with a number of banks from the existing consortium
that provided the $400 million facility. The $200 million facility was secured by a guarantee from Acergy S.A. and was used for the issuance of performance guarantees in the ordinary course of Acergy&#146;s business. The facility had a maturity date
of February&nbsp;26, 2013, however, performance guarantees could have been issued with a maturity no later than August&nbsp;26, 2014. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As at May&nbsp;31, 2010, Acergy had utilised $174 million of the $200 million facility for guarantee issuance. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On August&nbsp;10, 2010 Acergy S.A executed a $1.0 billion multi-currency revolving credit and guarantee facility with a number of banks. As part of the
terms of this agreement, the $200 million facility was cancelled and any amounts utilised on the execution date were transferred to the $1.0 billion facility, as described below. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The $1.0 billion multi-currency revolving credit and guarantee facility (the &#145;$1.0 billion facility&#146;) </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On August&nbsp;10, 2010 Acergy S.A. executed a $1.0 billion million multi-currency revolving credit and guarantee facility with a number of banks. The
facility can be used in full for the issuance of guarantees, or for a combination of guarantees and cash drawings subject to a $500 million sub-limit for cash drawings. The $1.0 billion facility is guaranteed by Acergy S.A., Class 3 Shipping
Limited, Acergy Shipping Limited and Acergy Treasury Limited. Final maturity will be August&nbsp;10, 2015, however, in accordance with the terms of the agreement, performance guarantees can be issued with up to 78 months duration up to one month
prior to the final maturity date of the facility, subject to Acergy providing cash cover for any guarantees outstanding following the final maturity date. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The $1.0 billion facility contains financial covenants in respect of leverage, interest coverage and gearing ratios. The requirements of the financial
covenants must be met on a consolidated basis at quarterly intervals ending February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;May&nbsp;31,&nbsp;August&nbsp;31 and November&nbsp;30 of each year. In addition to the financial covenants listed above, the facility contains
affirmative covenants, negative pledges and events of defaults which are customary for facilities of this nature and consistent with past practice. Such covenants specifically limit mergers or transfers, incurrence of other indebtedness, class 1
acquisitions, loans outside the Acergy Group and change of business. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The $1.0 billion facility also contains events of default provisions
which include payment defaults (subject to a three day grace period), breach of financial covenants, breach of other obligations, breach of representations and warranties, insolvency, illegality, unenforceability, conditions subsequent, curtailment
of business, claims against an obligor&#146;s assets, appropriation of an obligor&#146;s assets, cross-defaults to other indebtedness in excess of $10 million, failure to maintain exchange listing, material adverse change, auditor&#146;s
qualification, repudiation and material litigation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Interest on the $1.0 billion facility is payable at LIBOR plus a margin which is linked
to Acergy&#146;s leverage, measured as the ratio of net debt to EBITDA, and which may range from 1.75% to 2.75%&nbsp;per year. The fee applicable for guarantees is linked to the same ratio of net debt to EBITDA and may range from 1.75% to
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">124 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
2.75%&nbsp;per year in respect of financial guarantees and 0.875% to 1.375% in respect of performance guarantees. The margin and guarantee fee are reset quarterly in line with changes to
Acergy&#146;s leverage. As part of the terms of this agreement, Acergy&#146;s $400 million facility and $200 million facility have been cancelled and any amounts utilised on the execution date were transferred to the $1.0 billion facility.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>NOK 977.5&nbsp;million Loan and Guarantee Facility (the &#145;NOK 977.5&nbsp;million facility&#146;) </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Acergy Havila Limited is a 50/50 joint venture between Acergy Bermuda Ltd. (wholly owned by Acergy S.A.) and Havila Shipping Pte Ltd. (wholly owned by
Havila Shipping ASA). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On October&nbsp;14, 2008 Acergy completed a loan and guarantee facility for post-delivery financing of up to NOK
977.5&nbsp;million ($151.4 million) for the purchase of a dive support vessel to be owned by the joint venture. The facility was amended on June&nbsp;9, 2010 to extend the delivery date to February&nbsp;28, 2011 and the final termination date to be
no later than February&nbsp;28, 2021. Until delivery of the vessel takes place, which is scheduled to occur in 2011, the NOK 977.5&nbsp;million facility remains undrawn. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The NOK 977.5&nbsp;million facility contains the financial covenant that current assets of Acergy Havila Limited exceed current liabilities. This
requirement must be met at quarterly intervals ending February&nbsp;28, May&nbsp;31, August&nbsp;31 and November&nbsp;30 of each year. The facility also contains vessel covenants customary to a facility of this nature. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition to the above covenants, the facility also contains events of default provisions which include payment defaults (subject to a three day grace
period), breach of the financial covenant, breach of other obligations, breach of representations, insolvency, illegality, repudiation, material adverse effect, cross-defaults to other indebtedness in excess of $2.5 million for Acergy Havila Limited
and in excess of $5.0 million for Acergy S.A. and failure by Acergy S.A. to maintain exchange listing. The facility also contains negative pledges with respect to accounts receivable and cash. Security on the facility is provided by a first priority
mortgage on the vessel. A charter guarantee has been provided by Acergy S.A. In the event of an event of default occurring this charter guarantee turns into a several guarantee to be shared 50/50 by Acergy S.A. and Havila Shipping ASA. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The facility&#146;s commitment fee is set at a rate of 0.40%. Upon delivery of the vessel and following the amendment on June&nbsp;9, 2010, which
resulted in an increase in the margin, loan interest will be payable at NIBOR plus a margin of 1.65%&nbsp;per year. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.3.4 Guarantee arrangements with joint ventures </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">SapuraAcergy Assets Pte Ltd (&#145;SAPL&#146;), previously known as Nautical Vessels Pte Ltd., is a 50/50-owned joint venture between Nautical Essence
Sdn. Bhd. (wholly owned by SapuraCrest Petroleum Berhad) and Acergy Bermuda Ltd. (wholly owned by Acergy S.A.). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In 2007 the respective parent
companies of the joint venture partners issued a Charter Guarantee guaranteeing the charter payments from the charterer of the <I>Sapura 3000</I> vessel to the ship owner, SAPL. The limit of the guarantee is, at any time the sum of the outstanding
amounts under the $240 million Facility Agreement of SAPL less $100 million. Any call under the guarantee will not result in a lump sum payment being made, but the guarantors, severally, will have to service the debt by way of charter payments due
from the charterer to the ship owner until the termination date of the loan, which is February&nbsp;2, 2015. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">SapuraAcergy Sdn. Bhd.
(&#145;SASB&#146;) is a 50/50-owned joint venture between Nautical Essence Sdn. Bhd. (wholly owned by SapuraCrest Petroleum Berhad) and Acergy Bermuda Ltd. (wholly owned by Acergy S.A.). SASB has entered into a $181.3 million multi-currency facility
for the financing of the Shell Gumusut-Kakap Project. Both Acergy S.A. and SapuraCrest Petroleum Berhad have issued several guarantees, for 50% of the financing respectively. The facility consists of $41.3 million available for the issuance of bank
guarantees, $60.0 million available for letters of credit, and two revolving credit facilities for $60.0 million and $20.0 million respectively. At May&nbsp;31, 2010 the amount available for bank guarantees was fully utilised, $16.8 million of the
amount available for letters of credit was utilised and the $20 million revolving credit facility was fully utilised. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">125 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.3.5 Other credit facilities </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During fiscal year 2009, a facility of $0.2 million was provided to Pelagic Nigeria Limited by Pegasus International Services Inc., the minority interest
holder of Pelagic Nigeria Limited, an entity in which Acergy holds a majority interest. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Acergy also has bank overdraft facilities and short
term lines of credit of $34 million of which $nil were drawn as at May&nbsp;31, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.3.6 Other guarantee
arrangements </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition to the amounts available under the $1.0 billion facility, Acergy has a $30.0 million bank guarantee facility
with Credit Industriel et Commercial Bank of which $9 million was utilised as at May&nbsp;31, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">There is an unsecured local guarantee
facility in Nigeria for the sole use of Globestar Engineering Company (Nigeria) Limited. The line is with First Bank of Nigeria plc for $10.0 million. The bonds under this facility were issued to guarantee the project performance of the subsidiary
to third parties in the normal course of business. The amount issued under this facility as at May&nbsp;31, 2010 was $1 million. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Acergy has
past arrangements with a number of financial institutions to issue bank guarantees on its behalf. As at May&nbsp;31, 2010, the aggregate amount of guarantees issued under these old facilities was $14 million. There is no availability for further
issuances under these facilities. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.3.7 Effect of the Combination on credit and guarantee facilities
</I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If and when the Combination becomes effective, there will be no change to the terms of any of Acergy&#146;s credit and guarantee
facilities. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>12.4 Description of Subsea 7&#146;s indebtedness </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.4.1 Cash and cash equivalents </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As at June&nbsp;30, 2010 Subsea 7 held $471.8 million in cash and cash equivalents (including 1,094,004 shares in Acergy S.A. with fair market value of
$16.2 million). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.4.2 Convertible loan notes </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>$300 million 2.80% convertible loan notes due 2011 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On June&nbsp;6, 2006 Subsea 7 Inc. issued $300.0 million in aggregate principal amount of 2.80% convertible loan notes due 2011. The issuance was
completed on June&nbsp;6, 2006 with the receipt of net proceeds after deduction of issuance related costs of $294.8 million. The convertible loan notes have an annual interest of 2.80% payable semi-annually in arrears on June&nbsp;6 and
December&nbsp;6 of each year up to and including fiscal year 2011. They were issued at 100% of their principal amount and unless previously redeemed, converted or cancelled will mature on June&nbsp;6, 2011 at 100% of their principal amount. The
convertible loan notes are listed on Oslo B&oslash;rs. During fiscal years 2009 and the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010, Subsea 7 repurchased $51.0 million (par value) of the convertible loan notes for an average of 91.2% of their par value. As
at August&nbsp;31, 2010, Subsea 7 had repurchased a further $20.0 million (par value) of the convertible loan notes for an average of 99.6% of their par value. The repurchased convertible loan notes remain outstanding and have not been cancelled.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The noteholders were granted an option which allows them to convert their convertible loan notes into shares with an initial conversion price
of $26.3268 per share equivalent to 11,395,232 shares, or approximately 7.7% of Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s issued share capital at the date of issue. The current conversion price remains unchanged from the initial conversion price. Excluding loan notes
cancelled, redeemed or held in treasury, $249.0 million of these loan notes remain outstanding as of June&nbsp;30, 2010, equivalent to 9,458,043 shares, or approximately 6.4% of Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s issued share capital as of June&nbsp;30, 2010. The
conversion price may be adjusted in accordance with its terms and conditions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the terms of the convertible loan note, the
Combination will constitute a &#145;change of control&#146; which gives each noteholder the right to require Subsea 7 Inc. to redeem their notes at their principal amount together with interest accrued. In addition, any conversion within 60 days
following Completion shall be at a conversion price determined in accordance with the conditions of the notes, which is expected to be slightly lower than the initial conversion price. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">126 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>$175 million zero coupon convertible loan notes due 2017 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On June&nbsp;29, 2007 Subsea 7 Inc. issued $175.0 million in aggregate principal amount of zero coupon convertible loan notes due 2017. The issuance was
completed on June&nbsp;29, 2007 with the receipt of net proceeds after deduction of issuance related costs of $172.6 million. The convertible loan notes do not bear interest, but have a yield to maturity of 0.95%. They were issued at 100% of their
principal amount and unless previously redeemed, converted or cancelled will mature on June&nbsp;29, 2017 at 109.9% of their principal amount. The convertible loan notes are listed on Oslo B&oslash;rs. During fiscal year 2009, Subsea 7 repurchased
$40.5 million (par value) of the convertible loan notes for an average of 99.8% of their par value. Subsea 7 Inc. cancelled these loan notes on July&nbsp;2, 2010. Further, on June&nbsp;29, 2010, at the expiry of the applicable notice period,
noteholders representing $131.1 million par value of the outstanding loan notes had filed their put exercise notice for their loan notes to be redeemed at their accreted principal amount. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The noteholders were granted an option which allows them to convert the convertible notes into shares with an initial conversion price of $28.1772 per
share equivalent to 6,210,695 shares, or approximately 4.2% of Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s issued share capital at the date of issue. The current conversion price remains unchanged from the initial conversion price. Excluding notes cancelled, redeemed or
held in treasury, $3.4 million of these notes remain outstanding as of June&nbsp;30, 2010, equivalent to 120,665 shares, or approximately 0.1% of Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s issued share capital as of June&nbsp;30, 2010. The conversion price may be
adjusted in accordance with its terms and conditions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Due to the redemption of $131.1 million par value and the purchase (and corresponding
cancellation) of $40.5 million par value of the convertible notes, Subsea 7 Inc. has the right to call the remaining notes at any time and has undertaken in the Combination Agreement to redeem any notes outstanding on or prior to Completion.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>$275 million 3.50% convertible loan notes due 2014 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On October&nbsp;13, 2009 Subsea 7 Inc. issued $275.0 million in aggregate principal amount of 3.50% convertible loan notes due 2014. The issuance was
completed on October&nbsp;13, 2009 with the receipt of net proceeds after deduction of issuance related costs of $272.9 million. The issuance costs of $2.1 million have been split between the liability and equity components. The convertible loan
notes have an annual interest of 3.50% payable semi-annually in arrears on October&nbsp;13 and April&nbsp;13 of each year up to and including fiscal year 2014. They were issued at 100% of their principal amount and unless previously redeemed,
converted or cancelled will mature on October&nbsp;13, 2014 at 100% of their principal amount. The convertible loan notes are not listed. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The
noteholders were granted an option which allows them to convert the convertible loan notes into shares with an initial conversion price of $17.98 per share equivalent to 15,294,772 shares, or approximately 10.4% of Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s issued share
capital at the date of issue. The current conversion price remains unchanged from the initial conversion price. Excluding loan notes cancelled, redeemed or held in treasury, $275 million of these loan notes remain outstanding as of June&nbsp;30,
2010, equivalent to 15,294,772 shares, or approximately 10.4% of Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s issued share capital as of June&nbsp;30, 2010. The conversion price may be adjusted in accordance with its terms and conditions. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">With respect to this convertible loan notes, if and when the Combination with Acergy becomes effective, subject to meeting the requirements set out in
the terms and conditions of the notes, these notes will remain in place within the Combined Group. Arrangements will be put in place under which the indebtedness under these notes will be assumed by SUBSEA 7 S.A. solely or jointly with Subsea 7 Inc.
and these notes will be convertible into SUBSEA 7 S.A. Shares, under equivalent conversion terms of Subsea 7 Inc. shares to Acergy S.A. shares pursuant to the ratio of 1.065 SUBSEA 7 S.A. shares for each entitlement to one Subsea 7 Inc. share.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.4.3 Credit and Guarantee facilities </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subsea 7 had the following credit facilities as June&nbsp;30, 2010. All such facilities were undrawn at such date. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>$250 million amended and restated secured revolving credit and guarantee facilities agreement with DnB NOR Bank ASA </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On January&nbsp;30, 2009, Subsea 7 Inc. amended its banking facilities with DnB NOR Bank ASA to a $250 million credit and guarantee facility. This
facility comprises an uncommitted guarantee facility of $100 million and an aggregate of $150 million available for cash drawings (divided in two sub-facilities of $100 million and </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">127 </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
$50&nbsp;million respectively). As at July&nbsp;31, 2010 under the $250 million facility, Subsea 7 had utilised $69 million of the guarantee facility and $nil million of the revolving credit
facility. This facility includes a first priority mortgage over three of Subsea 7&#146;s vessels with a carrying value at December&nbsp;31, 2009 of $70.0 million. The facility has no mandatory reduction mechanisms with any outstanding debt repayable
on February&nbsp;13, 2012. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Interest on the $100 million sub-facility in the DnB NOR facility is payable at LIBOR plus a margin which is
linked to the ratio of financial debt to EBITDA and which may range from 0.4% to 0.8%&nbsp;per year. This rate is subject to a quarterly review. Interest on the $50 million sub-facility in the DnB NOR facility is payable at LIBOR plus 2.25%&nbsp;per
year, increasing to 2.75%&nbsp;per year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Payable guarantee commission on any outstanding bank guarantees under the facility is linked to the
ratio of financial debt to EBITDA and which may range from 0.4% to 0.8% per year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The $250 million facility also contains events of default
provision which include payment defaults (subject to a three day grace period), breach of financial covenants, breach of other obligations, breach of representations and warranties, insolvency, illegality, unenforceability, conditions subsequent,
curtailment of business, claims against an obligor&#146;s assets, final judgments, cross-defaults to other indebtedness in excess of $5.0 million, failure to maintain exchange listing, material adverse effect, repudiation and material litigation.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>$50 million multicurrency revolving credit facility with HSBC Bank plc </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;2, 2009, Subsea 7 Inc. concluded a multicurrency revolving credit facility with HSBC Bank plc for $50 million. As at July&nbsp;31, 2010
under the $50 million facility, Subsea 7 had utilised $nil million of the facility. The facility includes a first priority mortgage over one of Subsea 7&#146;s office sites with a carrying value at December&nbsp;31, 2009 of $49.1 million. The
facility has no mandatory reduction mechanisms with any outstanding debt repayable on April&nbsp;1, 2012. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Interest on the $50 million HSBC
facility is payable at LIBOR plus a margin of 2.25%&nbsp;per year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The $50 million facility also contains events of default provision which
include payment defaults (subject to a three day grace period), breach of financial covenants, breach of other obligations, breach of representations and warranties, insolvency and insolvency proceedings, illegality, unenforceability, conditions
subsequent, curtailment of business, claims against an obligor&#146;s assets, final judgments, cross-defaults to other indebtedness in excess of $5.0 million, material adverse effect, repudiation and material litigation. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>$50 million multicurrency revolving facilities agreement with Bank of Scotland plc </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On June&nbsp;17, 2009, Subsea 7 Inc. concluded a revolving facilities agreement with Bank of Scotland plc for $50 million. As at July&nbsp;31, 2010 under
the $50 million facility, Subsea 7 had utilised $nil million of the facility. The facility includes a first priority mortgage over one of Subsea 7&#146;s vessels with a carrying value at December&nbsp;31, 2009 of $19.1 million. The facility has no
mandatory reduction mechanisms with any outstanding debt repayable on June&nbsp;17, 2012. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Interest on the $50 million Bank of Scotland
facility is payable at LIBOR plus a margin of 2.50%&nbsp;per year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The $50 million facility also contains events of default provision which
include payment defaults (subject to a three day grace period), breach of financial covenants, breach of other obligations, breach of representations and warranties, insolvency and insolvency proceedings, illegality, unenforceability, conditions
subsequent, curtailment of business, claims against an obligor&#146;s assets, final judgments, cross-defaults to other indebtedness in excess of $5.0 million, material adverse effect, audit qualification, expropriation, repudiation and material
litigation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition to the above, Subsea 7 has the following guarantee facilities: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a $30 million uncommitted bank guarantee facility with Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Limited of which $14.7 million was utilised as at
July&nbsp;31, 2010; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">128 </FONT></P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.4.4 Other guarantee arrangements </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At July&nbsp;31, 2010 Subsea 7 had the following which are guarantees issued but not through a facility: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Nordea Bank NOK 41&nbsp;million ($6.64 million) issued by Subsea 7 Limited and Subsea 7 Norway with an indemnity from Subsea 7 Inc
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Brazilian insurance market BRL 85&nbsp;million ($47.97 million) issued by Subsea 7 Marine with an indemnity from Subsea 7 Inc.;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These guarantees are issued on a case by case basis. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>12.4.5 Effect of Combination on Credit and Guarantee facilities </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the terms of the credit facilities, if and when the Combination with Acergy becomes effective, it is likely that any outstanding balances on these
facilities will need to be repaid immediately upon Completion, subject to waivers being received from the relevant lenders. As at June&nbsp;30, 2010, there were no cash drawings under any of the credit facilities. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under the terms of the guarantee facilities, if and when the Combination with Acergy becomes effective, the guarantees will need to have cash collateral
provided or additional drawings will no longer be permissible on these facilities, subject to waivers being received from the relevant lenders. Any existing guarantees drawn at the date of Completion will be able to run to maturity. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As at the date of this prospectus, Subsea 7 Inc. had received waivers from all banking parties which had change of control clauses, authorising the
continuation of all the aforementioned Subsea 7 credit and guarantee facilities post the date of Completion. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>12.5 Working capital
statement </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Issuer believes that its ability to obtain funding from the sources described above is sufficient to provide the cash flows
necessary to satisfy present working capital and capital expenditure requirements, as well as meet debt repayments and other financial commitments for the next twelve months from the date of this prospectus. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">129 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc59275_13"></A>XIII. RETURNS TO SHAREHOLDERS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>13.1 General </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">SUBSEA 7 S.A.&#146;s
objective will be to give shareholders a competitive return on their invested capital over time. The return can be achieved through both an increase in the value of their shareholdings and through the payment of distributions or dividends.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The return to shareholders may be paid by any means permitted by Luxembourg law and the Proposed Articles of Incorporation, including through
the distribution of annual dividends, interim dividends, distributable reserves and attribution of Shares, always subject to the conditions of the Proposed Articles of Incorporation and subject to applicable law. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Interim and final dividends on common shares can be paid out of retained and current earnings, as well as paid in surplus after satisfaction of the legal
reserve detailed below. In the case of interim dividends, the satisfaction of all legal requirements must be certified by an independent auditor. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Luxembourg law authorises the payment of stock dividends if sufficient surplus exists to pay for the par value of the shares issued in connection with
any stock dividend. Luxembourg law requires that 5.0% of unconsolidated net profit each year be allocated to a legal reserve before declaration of dividends. This requirement continues until the reserve is 10.0% of SUBSEA 7 S.A.&#146;s issued
capital, after which no further allocations are required until further issuance of shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Information on corporate law rules concerning
dividends can be found under &#145;<I>XVII. Description of Share Capital&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;17.14. Distributions</I>&#146;. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>13.2 Acergy S.A.
historic dividends </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Acergy S.A. paid a dividend of $0.23 per Share to shareholders on June&nbsp;18, 2010 and to holders of ADS on
June&nbsp;23, 2010. A table of historical dividend per Share payments is shown below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

dividends </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subsea 7 Inc. has not paid any dividends to shareholders in the last four years. </FONT></P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc59275_14"></A>XIV. UNAUDITED PRO FORMA CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL
INFORMATION </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>OF SUBSEA 7 S.A. AS OF AND FOR THE SIX MONTHS ENDED MAY 31, 2010 </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Basis of Preparation </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The unaudited
pro forma condensed consolidated financial information has been prepared to reflect the combination of Acergy with Subsea 7 (hereinafter referred to as the &#145;Combination&#146;). The Combination will be accounted for as an acquisition of Subsea 7
by Acergy pursuant to IFRS 3 (revised), Business Combinations. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The unaudited pro forma condensed consolidated income statement for the
six months ended May&nbsp;31, 2010 has been prepared to reflect the Combination as if it had taken place on December&nbsp;1, 2009. The unaudited pro forma condensed consolidated balance sheet as of May&nbsp;31, 2010 has been prepared to reflect the
Combination as if it had taken place on May&nbsp;31, 2010. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The unaudited pro forma condensed consolidated income statement and balance
sheet (&#145;Consolidated Financial Information&#146;) has been prepared for illustrative purposes only. Because of its nature, it addresses a hypothetical situation and, therefore, does not represent SUBSEA 7 S.A.&#146;s actual financial position
or results. It does not purport to indicate the results of operations or the combined financial position that would have resulted had the Combination been completed at the beginning of the period presented, nor is it intended to be indicative of
expected results or operations in the future period or the future financial position of SUBSEA 7 S.A. The pro forma adjustments are based upon available information and certain assumptions that Acergy and Subsea 7 believe to be reasonable.
</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The following unaudited financial statements were taken as a basis for preparing the unaudited pro forma consolidated financial
information and are unadjusted in respect of the non-coterminous period ends: </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>the unaudited interim consolidated financial statements of Acergy for the six months ended May&nbsp;31, 2010; and</I> </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The Consolidated Financial Information should be read in conjunction with the notes thereto as well as the historical financial statements
incorporated by reference herein and which are available as indicated under &#145;XXI. Documents on Display&#146; below. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The audited
consolidated financial statements of Acergy for the year ended November&nbsp;30, 2009 were prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards as adopted by the European Union (&#145;IFRS&#146;). The audited consolidated
financial statements of Subsea 7 for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 were prepared in accordance with IFRS. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>In order to
consistently apply the accounting policies of Acergy to the preparation of the unaudited pro forma condensed consolidated financial information of SUBSEA 7 S.A., certain reclassifications and adjustments have been made to the unaudited interim
consolidated financial statements of Subsea 7. A reconciliation of these adjustments to the Consolidated Financial Information is set out below in sections 14.4 and 14.5. </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Management does not consider that the exercising of the options relating to the Convertible loan notes is directly attributable to the transaction.
Accordingly, the potential impact on the borrowings of the Combined Group, as described in section 12.4.2, has not been reflected in the Consolidated Financial Information. </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The Consolidated Financial Information is presented in millions of US dollars ($m) and all values are rounded to one decimal place except where
otherwise indicated. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The following tables set forth the Consolidated Financial Information of the Combined Group as of and for the six
months ended May&nbsp;31, 2010 prepared as described above. </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<TD>&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>14.3 Notes to the Consolidated Financial Information </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Pro forma adjustments </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(a) Acquisition of Subsea 7 </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">IFRS&nbsp;3 requires that business combinations are accounted for using the purchase method which requires the identification of an acquirer. For
accounting purposes, Acergy has been identified as the acquirer of Subsea 7 and accordingly the identifiable assets, liabilities and contingent liabilities of Subsea 7 that satisfy the recognition criteria are recognised at fair value at the
hypothetical acquisition date. Any excess of the consideration payable in the business combination over the net fair value of identifiable net assets acquired is recognised as goodwill. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">133 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table shows the preliminary pro forma adjustments to tangible and intangible assets (excluding
goodwill) totalling $553.2&nbsp;million compared with the respective book values at the interim balance sheet date as at June&nbsp;30, 2010, the assumed useful economic lives and the additional depreciation and amortisation expenses for the six
month period then ended. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.5</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1px">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">553.2</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">13.1</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR STYLE="font-size:1px">
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom">&nbsp;&nbsp;</TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="border-top:3px double #000000">&nbsp;</TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The preliminary estimate of goodwill of $795.9&nbsp;million arising
from the Combination has been calculated as the excess of the value of New Acergy Shares to be issued, as described in note (g)&nbsp;of section 14.3, over the estimated fair value of Subsea 7&#146;s identifiable assets and liabilities, measured as
at June&nbsp;30, 2010. The goodwill has been calculated using the fair value of Acergy&#146;s shares as at June&nbsp;30, 2010. The actual amount of goodwill arising on the transaction will depend upon the fair value of Acergy&#146;s shares at the
completion date of the Combination. For each $1 increase or decrease in the fair value of Acergy&#146;s shares, the goodwill will increase or decrease by $156.8 million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">IFRS 3 (revised) requires that the costs of the transaction are to be expensed as incurred. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(b) Subsea 7 investment in Acergy S.A. shares </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subsea 7 held 1,094,004 Shares with a fair market value of $16.2 million at June&nbsp;30, 2010. An adjustment of $16.2 million has been made to reflect
the reclassification of this item from available for sale financial assets to equity, as own shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(c) Elimination of
Subsea 7 gains and losses from trading in Acergy S.A. shares and convertible loan notes </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010, Subsea
7 reported gains of $8.0&nbsp;million and losses of $7.9&nbsp;million from trading, marking to market available-for-sale financial assets and income from investments in Acergy. These gains and losses have been eliminated in the unaudited pro forma
condensed consolidated income statement on the basis that they would represent intra-group transactions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(d) Transaction
costs </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The total transaction costs to effect the Combination have been estimated to be approximately $25.0 million based on each
party&#146;s assessment of its own costs, and will not have a continuing impact on the Combined Group. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These are assumed to have been
incurred in full at the date of Completion reflected in the income statement and balance sheet respectively, as outlined above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The pro forma
income statement has been prepared to reflect the Combination as if it had occurred on December&nbsp;1, 2009. As a result, the income statement of both Acergy and Subsea 7 have been adjusted to reverse the costs accrued by both parties during their
respective results for the six months ended May&nbsp;31, 2010 and June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The pro forma balance sheet reflects the position of
the Combined Group after providing for these costs in full. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(e) Pro forma adjustments to income taxes </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Tax effect of pro forma adjustments </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In order to reflect the tax effect on the pro forma adjustments discussed above (paragraphs (a)&nbsp;to (c)), a decrease to income tax charge of
$3.2&nbsp;million has been reflected in the unaudited pro forma condensed consolidated </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">134 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">
income statement, and an increase in deferred tax liabilities of $135.9&nbsp;million has been reflected in the unaudited pro forma condensed consolidated balance sheet. The tax rates applied
reflect the statutory tax rates in the relevant jurisdictions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Tax effects arising from Combination </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Ongoing effect of any change in the way the UK ship operating subsidiaries of the Combined Group are taxed in the UK </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Management considers that at the unaudited pro forma balance sheet date, there is no certainty as to whether the UK ship operating subsidiaries of the
Combined Group will be subject to tonnage tax or subject to standard UK Corporation Tax following Completion of the transaction. Therefore the potential impact of the transaction on the tax position of the Combined Group, as noted in section
&#145;<I>II. Risk Factors &#151; 2.4. Financial and Compliance Risks&nbsp;2.4.6</I>&#146;, has not been reflected in the Consolidated Financial Information. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>One- off effect of any change in the way the UK ship operating subsidiaries of the Combined Group are taxed in the UK </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition to the above, there would also be a one-off impact of any change in the way in which the UK ship operating subsidiaries of the Combined Group
are taxed in the UK. For illustrative purposes, management has estimated the impact of this one-off adjustment on the unaudited pro forma consolidated balance sheet.&nbsp;If Acergy&#146;s UK ship operating subsidiaries leave tonnage tax as a
consequence of the Combination, the deferred tax liability in the pro forma balance sheet would increase by approximately $48.6 million with a corresponding charge to the income statement, which would lead to a reduction in equity.&nbsp;However, if
Subsea 7&#146;s UK ship operating subsidiaries enter tonnage tax as a consequence of the Combination, the deferred tax liability in the pro forma balance sheet would decrease by approximately $134.7 million with a corresponding reduction to
goodwill. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(f) Earnings per share </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The calculation of the pro forma earnings per share is based on the weighted average basic number of Acergy S.A. Shares outstanding during its six month
interim period 2010, being 183,369,857 Shares plus the weighted average basic number of Subsea 7 Inc. shares outstanding during its six month interim period 2010 of 147,165,554, multiplied by the Scheme Ratio for New Acergy Shares to be issued on
Completion, giving rise to a further 156,731,315 Shares in Acergy S.A. included in the calculation of basic pro forma earnings per share. On Completion, the 1,094,004 Shares currently held by Subsea 7 would be reclassified as treasury shares and
excluded from the weighted average basic number of Shares of SUBSEA 7 S.A. which, for the purpose of this calculation, therefore is 339,007,168. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(g) Increase in share capital and share premium </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Adjustment reflects the repurchase and cancellation of all of the issued and outstanding ordinary shares in the capital of Subsea 7 Inc., the issue by
Subsea 7 Inc. of new ordinary shares in its capital to Acergy S.A. and the issue of 156,810,472 New Acergy Shares to the Scheme Shareholders pursuant to the Combination Agreement, based on the closing share price of Acergy S.A. as at June&nbsp;30,
2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(h) Application of IAS 27 Consolidated and Separate Financial Statements </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The adjustment reflects the application of the consolidation procedures of IAS 27 Consolidated and Separate Financial Statements which requires Subsea
7&#146;s share capital and pre-acquisition reserves attributable to the parent to be eliminated. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(i) Reclassification and
fair market valuation of employee benefit trust </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Acergy has 583,000 Shares held in an employee benefit trust effective April 2010, which
are accounted for as Own shares. Consequently the 1,789,990 Subsea 7 Inc. shares held in the Subsea 7 employee benefit trust, with a historic cost totalling $9.4 million, have also been reallocated from Shares held by Employee Share Trust to Own
shares. The number of New Acergy Shares to be issued against such shares based on the Scheme Ratio is 1,906,339 (1,789,990 x 1.065). An adjustment of $28.7 million has been made to reflect the fair market value of these New Acergy Shares based on
the fair market values of Shares at June&nbsp;30, 2010 (1,906,339 x $15.06&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;see adjustment (g)). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">136 </FONT></P>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Note:</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The reclassification adjustments represent the
changes to Subsea 7 financial information so that it is presented in the same format as adopted by Acergy. The remeasurement adjustments represent the changes required to align the Subsea 7 accounting policy for decommissioning expenditure with the
accounting policy applied by Acergy. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
