7 Inc. Convertible loan notes and the respective option plans of Acergy S.A. and Subsea 7 Inc. please refer to &#145;<I>XII. Capitalisation and Indebtedness</I>&#146; and &#145;<I>XVI. Management and Employees</I>&#146;. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The New Acergy Shares to be issued in consideration for the contribution of the entire share capital in Subsea 7 Inc. will be created under Luxembourg
law, and will have the rights as set forth in the Proposed Articles of Incorporation attached hereto as Annex A-2, and Luxembourg law. Based on the number of shares outstanding as at August&nbsp;31, 2010 in each of Acergy S.A. and Subsea 7 Inc., the
Scheme Shareholders will hold approximately 46% of the Shares in SUBSEA 7 S.A. then in issue. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">166 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.3 Form and transfer of shares </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Shares are issued in registered form only and are freely transferable. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under Luxembourg law, the ownership of registered shares is evidenced by the inscription of the name of the shareholder, the number of shares held by
that shareholder and the amount paid up on each share. Transfers of shares shall be effected by written declaration of transfer to be recorded in the shareholder register, such declaration to be dated and signed by the transferor and the transferee,
or by their duly appointed agents. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Issuer may appoint registrars in different jurisdictions, each of whom will maintain a separate
register in paper or electronic form for the shares entered in such register. DnB NOR Bank ASA has been appointed as registrar for shares traded on Oslo B&oslash;rs and settled through the book-entry system maintained by VPS. In the VPS, Deutsche
Bank Trust Company Americas are registered as shareholders for all shares which underlie the ADSs. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Shares held with financial intermediaries
or through a securities settlement system may be transferred in accordance with customary procedures for the transfer of securities in book entry form. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Acergy S.A. Shares trade in the form of an ADS in the United States on the NASDAQ Global Select Market, currently under the symbol &#145;ACGY&#146;
and as from the first trading day following Completion under the symbol &#145;SUBC&#146;. They are also listed in Norway on Oslo B&oslash;rs, currently under the symbol &#145;ACY&#146; and as from the first trading day following Completion is
anticipated to be under the symbol &#145;SUBC&#146;. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For market information on Acergy S.A. shares and Subsea 7 Inc. shares see
&#145;<I>XVIII. Trading Market and Main Shareholding</I>&#146;. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.4 Issuance of Shares </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Acergy S.A. currently has an authorised share capital of $460,000,000 represented by 230,000,000 common shares of a nominal value of $2. As at
August&nbsp;31, 2010, there are 35,046,028 Acergy S.A. common shares available for issuance under the present authority of the Board of Directors, which will expire on March&nbsp;24, 2015. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subject to the approval of the Acergy Combination EGM, the authorised share capital (including the issued share capital) will increase to $900,000,000
represented by 450,000,000 Shares with a nominal value of $2 each. The Board of Directors will then be authorised to issue up to 255,046,028 New Acergy Shares, of which 156,813,134 new Shares are reserved for issue to the Scheme Shareholders under
the Scheme of Arrangement (on the basis of the Subsea 7 Inc. shares outstanding as at August&nbsp;31, 2010). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board of Directors will be
authorised to issue Shares within the limits of the authorised unissued share capital at such times and on such terms as it or its delegates may decide, for a period commencing on the date of the Acergy Combination EGM which granted the
authorisation, and ending five years after the date on which the minutes of such Acergy Combination EGM have been published in the Luxembourg official gazette (<I>M&eacute;morial C, Recueil des Soci&eacute;t&eacute;s et Associations</I>) without
prejudice to its extension, amendment or renewal. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Articles of Incorporation provide that no fractional shares may be issued. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition to the authorised Acergy S.A. common shares, there are also authorised 1,500,000 Class&nbsp;A shares of a par value of $2 per share. Such
Class&nbsp;A shares have been authorised for the sole purpose of options granted under certain of Acergy S.A.&#146;s stock option plans in respect of the common shares of Acergy S.A. All such Class&nbsp;A shares shall convert to Shares immediately
upon issuance. Such authorised Class&nbsp;A Shares shall exist only until December&nbsp;31, 2010 and shall expire without further action at that date. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.5 Restrictions on shareholders </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">There
are no limitations currently imposed by Luxembourg law on the rights of non-resident shareholders to hold or vote their shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Below is a
summary of certain restrictions and related powers of the Board of Directors provided by article 33 of the current Articles of Incorporation. As from the date following the Relevant Date, article 33 will, without further action, be deemed deleted
from the Articles of Incorporation. To the extent Completion is expected to occur after January 1, 2011, article 33 will not be applicable within SUBSEA 7 S.A. </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">167 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Articles of Incorporation provide that in recognition of the fact that certain shareholdings may
threaten the Issuer with &#145;imminent and grave damage,&#146; which term includes adverse tax consequences, a hostile takeover attempt or adverse governmental sanctions, (i)&nbsp;no US Person (as defined in the Articles of Incorporation) shall
own, directly or indirectly, more than 9.9% of Acergy S.A.&#146;s issued common shares, and (ii)&nbsp;all shareholders of any single country may not own, directly or indirectly, more than 49.9% of Acergy S.A.&#146;s issued common shares. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, according to the Articles of Incorporation, the Board of Directors is authorised to restrict, reduce or prevent the ownership of Shares if
it appears to the Board of Directors that such ownership may threaten the Issuer with &#145;imminent and grave damage.&#146; The Issuer has been advised by its Luxembourg counsel, Elvinger, Hoss&nbsp;&amp; Prussen, that there are no Luxembourg
judicial interpretations of such phrase, but that situations involving hostile takeovers, adverse tax consequences to the Issuer or governmental sanctions are likely to be among the situations covered by that phrase. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In order to enforce the foregoing restrictions, the Articles of Incorporation empower the Board of Directors to take certain remedial action including
causing the Issuer: (i)&nbsp;to decline to register any prohibited transfer; (ii)&nbsp;to decline to recognise any vote of a shareholder precluded from holding Shares; (iii)&nbsp;to require any shareholder on its register of shareholders or any
prospective shareholder to provide information to determine whether such person is precluded from holding Shares; and (iv)&nbsp;upon the issuance of a notice, to require the sale of Shares to the Issuer at the lesser of (A)&nbsp;the amount paid for
the Shares if acquired within the twelve months immediately preceding the date of the notice, and (B)&nbsp;the last quoted sale price for the Shares on the day immediately preceding the day on which the notice is served (provided that the Board of
Directors may in its discretion resolve to pay the amount calculated under (B)&nbsp;in situations where (A)&nbsp;would otherwise apply and result in a lower purchase price, if the Board of Directors determines it equitable after taking into account
specified factors: and to remove the name of any shareholder from the register of shareholders immediately after the close of business on the day the notice is issued and payment is made available. The foregoing defensive measures may have the
effect of making a merger involving the Issuer more difficult, or a tender offer, open-market purchase program or other purchase of the shares, in circumstances that could give shareholders the opportunity to realise a premium over the then
prevailing market price for their Shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.6 Preferential subscription rights </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As a general rule, shareholders are entitled to preferential subscription rights under Luxembourg law where Shares are issued for cash. The General
Meeting of shareholders may however suppress or limit, or authorise the Board of Directors to suppress or limit, such preferential subscription rights of shareholders. The Board of Directors is currently authorised to suppress shareholders&#146;
preferential subscription rights to the extent it deems relevant. This authorisation is valid for a period of five years ending on March&nbsp;24, 2015. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subject to approval by the Acergy Combination EGM, the authorisation to the Board of Directors to suppress preferential subscription rights of
shareholders in case of issuance of Shares against cash will be renewed for a duration ending five years after the publication in the Luxembourg legal gazette of the minutes of the Acergy Combination EGM approving such authorisation. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The general meeting may amend, renew or extend such authorisation. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board of Directors will suppress such preferential subscription rights in connection with the Acergy Convertible loan notes, the assumption of the
capacity as issuer under the Subsea 7 Inc. Convertible loan notes, the Acergy S.A. option plan(s) and may do so with regard to obligations under the Subsea 7 Inc. share option plans pursuant to the Combination Agreement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.7 Authorisation to acquire shares (Treasury shares) </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Issuer cannot subscribe for its own shares. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Issuer may, however, repurchase issued shares or cause another person to repurchase issued shares for its account, subject to the following
conditions: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the prior authorisation of the general meeting of shareholders (subject to the quorum and majority required for ordinary resolutions), which
authorisation sets forth the terms and conditions of the proposed repurchase and in particular the maximum number of shares to be repurchased, the duration of the period for which the authorisation is given (which may not exceed five years) and, in
the case of repurchase for consideration, the minimum and maximum consideration per share, must have been obtained; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">168 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">the repurchase may not reduce the Issuer&#146;s net assets on a non-consolidated basis to a level below the aggregate of the issued share capital and
the reserves that the Issuer must maintain pursuant to Luxembourg law or its Articles of Incorporation; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">only fully paid up shares may be repurchased. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, pursuant to Luxembourg law the Board of Directors may repurchase shares without the prior approval of the general meeting of shareholders if
necessary to prevent serious and imminent harm to the Issuer or if the acquisition of shares has been made in view of the distribution thereof to the employees. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The shareholders of the Issuer resolved at its annual general meeting of shareholders on May&nbsp;28, 2010 to authorise the Issuer, or any wholly-owned
subsidiary, to purchase common shares of the Issuer up to a maximum of 10% of the issued common shares net of the common shares previously repurchased and still held, at a price reflecting such open market price and on such other terms as shall be
determined by the Board of Directors of the Issuer, provided (a)&nbsp;the maximum price to be paid for such common shares shall not exceed the average closing price for such common shares on Oslo B&oslash;rs (or the average closing price ADSs on the
NASDAQ GSM if applicable) for the five most recent trading days prior to such purchase and (b)&nbsp;the minimum price to be paid for such common shares shall not be less than the par value (i.e. $2 per share) thereof and further provided such
purchases are in conformity with article 49-2 of the Luxembourg law of August&nbsp;10, 1915 on commercial companies, as amended, such authorisation being granted for purchases completed on or before August&nbsp;31, 2011. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As at August&nbsp;31, 2010 the Issuer retained 10,799,095 treasury shares. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.8 Capital reduction </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The issued share
capital may be reduced subject to the approval by the general meeting of shareholders with the quorum and majority provided for the amendment of the Articles of Incorporation (see &#145;<I>17.12 Amendment to the Articles of Incorporation</I>&#146;
of this section). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.9 Voting rights </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each share entitles the holder thereof to one vote at a general meeting of shareholders. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Shareholders holding shares registered in VPS or other such depositary may attend and vote at the general meetings of the Issuer. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.10 General Meeting of Shareholders </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each Share entitles the holder thereof to attend all general meetings of shareholders, either in person or by proxy, to address the general meeting of
shareholders, and to exercise voting rights. Each share entitles the holder to one vote at a general meeting of shareholders. There is no minimum shareholding required to be able to attend or vote at a general meeting of shareholders. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A shareholder may act at any general meeting of shareholders by appointing another person (who need not be a shareholder) as his/her/its proxy. Such
proxy shall be in writing and must under the current Articles of Incorporation be deposited at the registered office in Luxembourg or with any director at least five days before the meeting. Under the Proposed Articles of Incorporation, this period
shall be reduced to two days or such lesser period as determined by the Issuer. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">General meetings of shareholders will be convened in
accordance with the provisions of the Luxembourg law of August&nbsp;10, 1915 on commercial companies, as amended, and the Proposed Articles of Incorporation. Convening notices will be by two notices published at least eight days apart and in the
case of the second notice, at least eight days before the meeting in the Luxembourg official gazette (<I>M&eacute;morial C, Recueil des Soci&eacute;t&eacute;s et Associations</I>), and in a Luxembourg newspaper. These convening notices must contain
the agenda of the meeting and set out the conditions for attendance and representation at the meeting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Notices for the general meetings of
shareholders shall also be given by mail, postage prepaid, to all holders of shares, sent to the address recorded in the shareholders&#146; register(s), and posted not later than twenty-one (21)&nbsp;days before the date set for the meeting.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">169 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Articles of Incorporation also allow notices to be given alternatively by e-mail to shareholders who
have indicated an e-mail address in the shareholders&#146; register, sent not later than twenty-one (21)&nbsp;days before the date set for the meeting. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">General meetings are convened by the Board of Directors which determines their agenda. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board of Directors is obliged to convene a General Meeting of shareholders if they receive a written request so to do from shareholders representing
in aggregate, 10% of the issued share capital. The general meeting shall be held within thirty (30)&nbsp;days of receipt of the request accompanied by an indication of the agenda. Luxembourg law in addition provides that shareholders representing,
in aggregate, 10% of the issued share capital may request that additional items be added to the agenda of a general meeting of shareholders. That request must be made by registered mail sent to the registered office of the Issuer at least five
(5)&nbsp;days before the date of the general meeting of shareholders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board of Directors is entitled to adjourn any general meeting while
in session. The Board must do so if requested by shareholders representing in the aggregate at least 20% of the issued capital of the Issuer. Any such adjournment will cancel any resolution already passed at the general meeting. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Luxembourg law distinguishes between &#145;ordinary&#146; general meetings of shareholders and &#145;extraordinary&#146; general meetings of
shareholders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Extraordinary general meetings of shareholders are convened to resolve upon an amendment to the Articles of Incorporation and
certain other limited matters described below and are subject to the quorum and majority requirements described below. All other general meetings of shareholders are ordinary general meetings of shareholders. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Ordinary general meetings of shareholders.</U> At ordinary general meetings of shareholders there is no quorum requirement, and resolutions are
adopted by a simple majority of the votes cast, irrespective of the number of shares present or represented. Abstentions are not considered as &#145;votes&#146;. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Extraordinary general meetings of shareholders.</U> An extraordinary general meeting of shareholders convened for the purpose of (a)&nbsp;an increase
or decrease of the authorised or issued capital, (b)&nbsp;a limitation or exclusion of preferential subscription rights, (c)&nbsp;the approval of a legal merger or division (<I>scission</I>) or certain similar corporate restructurings,
(d)&nbsp;dissolution and liquidation of the Issuer (except in circumstances where the Issuer has lost more than three quarters of its share capital) or (e)&nbsp;an amendment of the Articles of Incorporation, must have a quorum of at least 50% of the
capital present or represented. If that quorum is not reached, the extraordinary general meeting of shareholders may be reconvened. At such reconvened meeting, no quorum will be required. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Irrespective of whether the proposed matter will be subject to a vote at the first or at a subsequent extraordinary general meeting of shareholders, its
approval will require at least two thirds of the votes cast in favour at such extraordinary general meeting of shareholders. Abstentions are not considered as &#145;votes&#146;. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A vote to change the country of incorporation to a country other than Luxembourg or to increase the contribution of the shareholders will require the
affirmative vote of 100% of the Shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.11 Annual General Meeting </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The next annual ordinary general meeting of shareholders will be held in Luxembourg on Friday, May&nbsp;27, 2011 at 3 p.m. Under the Proposed Articles of
Incorporation, the annual general meeting will, starting in 2012, be held on the fourth Friday in June of each year, at 3 p.m. If that day is a legal or banking holiday, the meeting will be held on the first following working day. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.12 Amendments to the Articles of Incorporation </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Luxembourg law requires an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders to resolve upon any amendment to the Articles of Incorporation. The agenda of the
extraordinary general meeting of shareholders must indicate the proposed amendments to the Articles of Incorporation. See &#145;<I>17.10 General Meeting of Shareholders &#151; Extraordinary general meeting of shareholders</I>&#146; of this section.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">170 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.13 Liquidation </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the event of the liquidation, dissolution or winding-up of the Issuer, the assets remaining after allowing for the payment of all liabilities will be
paid out to the shareholders pro rata to their respective shareholdings. Other than in the case of a judicial liquidation, the decisions to liquidate, dissolve or wind-up the Company, require the approval by an extraordinary general meeting of
shareholders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.14 Distributions </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subject to Luxembourg law, each share is entitled to participate equally in dividends or other distributions. Dividends or other distributions are to be
approved by the annual ordinary general meeting of shareholders out of funds legally available for such purposes. The Board of Directors may also declare interim dividends or other distributions, to the extent permitted by Luxembourg law.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Luxembourg law requires that 5% of the unconsolidated net profit each year be allocated to a legal reserve before declaration of dividends.
This requirement continues until the reserve is 10% of the issued capital, after which no further allocations are required until the share capital is increased. The legal reserve may also be satisfied by allocation of the required amount at the time
of issuance of shares or by a transfer from paid-in surplus. The legal reserve is not available for dividends. The legal reserve for all existing shares has been satisfied to date and appropriate allocations will be made to the legal reserve account
at the time of each new issuance of shares. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Following Combination and the resulting increase in the issued share capital, the legal reserve
of the Issuer will be less than 10% of the issued share capital. The Issuer will propose to make appropriate allocations from paid in surplus to satisfy the requirement. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Declared and unpaid distributions held by the Issuer or its agents for the account of shareholders shall not bear interest. Under Luxembourg law, claims
for unpaid distributions will lapse in favour of the Issuer five years after the date such distribution has been declared. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.15 Annual
accounts </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Each year the Board of Directors must prepare annual accounts, that is, an inventory of the assets and liabilities of the Issuer
together with a balance sheet and a profit and loss account. The Board of Directors must also each year prepare consolidated accounts and management reports on the annual accounts and consolidated accounts. The annual accounts, the consolidated
accounts, to the extent required, the management report and the auditor&#146;s reports must be available for inspection by shareholders at the registered office of the Issuer at least fifteen (15)&nbsp;calendar days prior to the date of the annual
ordinary general meeting of shareholders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The annual accounts and the consolidated accounts, after approval by the annual ordinary general
meeting of shareholders, will be filed with the <I>Registre de Commerce et des Soci&eacute;t&eacute;s </I>in Luxembourg. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Issuer&#146;s
financial statements are audited by independent auditors who are appointed by the ordinary general meeting of shareholders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.16
Information rights </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Luxembourg law gives shareholders limited rights to inspect certain corporate records fifteen (15)&nbsp;calendar days
prior to the date of the annual ordinary general meeting of shareholders, including the annual accounts with a list of directors and auditors, the consolidated accounts, the notes to the annual accounts and the consolidated accounts, a list of
shareholders whose shares are not fully paid-up, the management reports and the auditor&#146;s reports. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The annual accounts, the consolidated
accounts, the auditor&#146;s reports and the management reports are sent to shareholders directly registered in the register of shareholders twenty-one (21)&nbsp;days before the annual ordinary general meeting of shareholders. In addition, any
shareholder is entitled to receive a copy of these documents free of charge fifteen (15)&nbsp;calendar days prior to the date of the annual ordinary general meeting of shareholders. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Under Luxembourg law, it is generally accepted that at the relevant general meeting a shareholder has the right to receive responses to questions
concerning items on the agenda for a general meeting of shareholders, if such responses are necessary or useful for a shareholder to make an informed decision concerning such agenda item, unless a response to such questions could be detrimental to
the Issuer&#146;s interests. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">171 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.17 Take-over &#151; mandatory bid threshold, squeeze out and sell-out rights </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Issuer&#146;s shares are listed on Oslo B&oslash;rs which constitutes a regulated market for the purpose of the European Takeover Directive
(2004/25/EC). The authority competent to supervise any takeover bid on the Issuer will be the competent authority in Norway, The Financial Supervisory Authority of Norway (<I>Finanstilsynet</I>). The Takeover Directive and Norwegian and Luxembourg
law implementing the directive provide for the requirement that where a person, acting alone or in concert, acquires shares in the Issuer which, when added to any existing holdings in shares give such person (or persons) voting rights sufficient for
such person or persons to control the Issuer, such person is obliged to make an offer for the remaining shares in the Issuer. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the Takeover Directive, the threshold for obtaining control is a matter for Luxembourg law under which the control
threshold is 33<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">3</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">% of the voting rights attached
to all issued shares in the Issuer. </FONT></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to Luxembourg takeover law when an offer (mandatory or voluntary) is made to all of the
holders of voting securities of the Issuer and after such offer the offeror holds 95% of the securities carrying voting rights and 95% of the voting rights, it can require the holders of the remaining securities to sell those securities (of the same
class) to the offeror. Furthermore Luxembourg takeover law provides that, when an offer (mandatory or voluntary) is made to all of the holders of voting securities of the Issuer and after such offer the offeror holds 90% of the securities carrying
voting rights and 90% of the voting rights, each of the remaining security holders can require that the offeror purchases its securities (of the same class). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.18 Disclosure of significant ownership in Shares </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Holders of shares and of derivatives or other financial instruments linked to Shares may be subject to notification obligations pursuant to the Luxembourg
law of January&nbsp;11, 2008 on transparency requirements regarding information about issuers whose securities are admitted to trading on a regulated market (the &#145;Transparency Law&#146;). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following description summarises those obligations. Holders of shares are advised to consult with their legal advisers to determine whether any
notification obligations apply to them. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px;padding-bottom:0px;"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Transparency Law requires that if a natural person or legal entity acquires
or disposes of a holding in the Issuer, and if following that acquisition or disposal, the proportion of voting rights held by that person or legal entity reaches, exceeds or falls below one of the thresholds of 5%, 10%, 15%, 20%, 25%,
33<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&nbsp;1</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">3</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">%, 50% and
66<FONT SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&nbsp;2</SUP></FONT><FONT SIZE="2">/</FONT><FONT SIZE="1">3</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">% of the total voting rights existing when the
situation giving rise to a declaration occurs, such person must simultaneously notify the Issuer and the CSSF of such event. </FONT></FONT></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Disclosure to the public will be made by the Issuer publishing the information. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For the purposes of calculating the percentage of voting rights held by a person or entity the following will be taken into account: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">voting rights held by a third party with whom that person or entity has concluded an agreement and which obliges them to adopt, by concerted exercise
of the voting rights they hold, a lasting common policy towards the Issuer; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">voting rights held by a third party under an agreement concluded with that person or entity providing for the temporary transfer for consideration of
the voting rights in question; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">voting rights attaching to shares pledged as collateral with that person or entity, provided that person or entity controls the voting rights and
declares its intention to exercise them; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">voting rights attaching to shares in which a person or entity holds an interest for the duration of the life of such person or entity;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">voting rights which are held or may be exercised within the meaning of the four foregoing points by an undertaking controlled by that person or entity;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">voting rights attaching to shares deposited by investors with that person or entity which the person or entity may exercise at its discretion in the
absence of specific instructions from such investor; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">voting rights held by a third party in its own name but on behalf of that person or entity; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">voting rights which that person or entity may exercise as a proxy where the person or entity may exercise the voting rights in its sole discretion.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">172 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Voting rights in the Issuer shall be calculated on the basis of all the issued shares, to which voting
rights are attached even if the exercise thereof is suspended (as is the case with the common shares retained as treasury shares). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Shareholders must also notify the Issuer of the proportion of their voting rights, where that proportion reaches, exceeds or falls below any of the
aforesaid thresholds as a result of events changing the breakdown of voting rights in the Issuer (such as an increase or reduction of capital of the Issuer), and on the basis of the information disclosed from time to time by the Issuer pursuant to
article 14 of the Transparency Law. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with article 14 of the Transparency Law, the Issuer will publish the total number of voting
rights in the Issuer and its total share capital at the end of the calendar month during which Completion occurs. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, a statement
regarding beneficial ownership of Shares is required to be filed with the US Securities and Exchange Commission pursuant to the US Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, by holders who individually or as a group beneficially own more than 5%
of the Shares of the Issuer. These reporting obligations also require such holders to promptly amend their beneficial ownership statements whenever any material change occurs in the facts set forth in a previously filed statement. Holders of the
Issuer&#146;s Shares should consult their own legal counsel for a detailed description of the regulations related to such reporting requirements. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>17.19 Share Trading, Clearing and Settlement </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>General </I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The
Issuer&#146;s shares are in registered form only and are freely transferable. Ownership of the Issuer&#146;s shares is recorded in the shareholder register kept by the Issuer at its registered office at 412 F, route d&#146;Esch, L- 2086, Grand Duchy
of Luxembourg (the &#145;Shareholder Register&#146;). The registration of the Issuer&#146;s shares in registered form in the Shareholder Register may be evidenced by a certificate at the option of the shareholder concerned. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Shareholders who are not directly registered in the Shareholder Register of the Issuer will hold shares in book-entry form with either VPS, the central
depositary of Oslo B&oslash;rs, with office address at Biskop Gunnerus&#146; gate 14A, 0185 Oslo, Norway and with mailing address at Postboks 4, 0051 Oslo, Norway, or, in respect of the Issuer&#146;s American Depositary Shares (ADSs), with Deutsche
Bank Trust Company Americas. Acergy has a sponsored Level II ADR facility for which Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas acts as depositary. Each ADS represents one common share. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Existing and newly-issued Shares of the Issuer will be admitted to trading and listing on Oslo B&oslash;rs, where the Acergy S.A. shares are currently
traded and listed. Any trades of the Issuer&#146;s Shares on Oslo B&oslash;rs will be settled through the book-entry system maintained by VPS. DnB NOR Bank ASA acts as registrar for these shares. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Issuer&#146;s ADSs will continue to be traded solely on NASDAQ. Any trades in ADSs will be settled through the Depositary Trust Company
(&#147;DTC&#148;) system in the US. Any cross-border trades will be handled by Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas, who will continue to act as depositary. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Market Descriptions </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Oslo B&oslash;rs, on which both the Issuer&#146;s common shares and Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s shares are currently traded, is a regulated market for securities
trading in Norway. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">NASDAQ, on which the Issuer&#146;s ADSs are traded, is the largest electronic screen-based equity securities trading
market in the United States. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Clearance and Settlement Systems </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The VPS, the central depositary of Oslo B&oslash;rs, is the clearance and settlement system for the Issuer&#146;s shares. DTC, the clearing and settlement
system in the US for book-entry securities, is responsible for clearance and settlement in relation to the Issuer&#146;s ADSs. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Issuer
will not have any responsibility for the performance of any such clearing system or their respective participants or indirect participants, or their respective obligations under the rules and procedures governing their operations. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">173 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Security Codes </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The ticker symbol on Oslo B&oslash;rs for the Issuer&#146;s shares is ACY. The ISIN code for the Issuer&#146;s shares on Oslo B&oslash;rs is LU0075646355.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The ticker symbol for the Issuer&#146;s ADSs is ACGY. The ISIN code for the Issuer&#146;s ADSs is US00443E1047. Following Completion, the
ticker symbol for the Issuer&#146;s ADSs will be changed to SUBC. Following Completion, the ISIN code for the Issuer&#146;s ADSs will remain US00443E1047. </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc59275_18"></A>XVIII. TRADING MARKETS AND MAIN SHAREHOLDING </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>18.1 Trading Markets </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Acergy S.A.&#146;s
shares trade in the form of ADSs in the United States on NASDAQ Global Select Market under the symbol &#145;ACGY&#146; and are listed in Norway on Oslo B&oslash;rs under the symbol &#145;ACY.&#146; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s shares are listed in Norway on Oslo B&oslash;rs under the symbol &#145;SUB.&#146; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table sets forth the high and low last reported prices for Acergy S.A.&#146;s ADSs on NASDAQ Global Select Market and the prices for Acergy
S.A&#146;s and Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s shares reported on Oslo B&oslash;rs during the indicated periods. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On August&nbsp;31, 2010 the last reported sale price of Acergy S.A. ADSs on NASDAQ Global Select Market was $15.36 per ADS and the closing price of
Acergy S.A.&#146;s shares on Oslo B&oslash;rs was NOK 96.85&nbsp;per share. On August&nbsp;31, 2010 the closing price of Subsea 7 Inc. shares on Oslo B&oslash;rs was NOK 100.30&nbsp;per share. </FONT></P>

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>18.2 Major shareholders </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Except as set forth below, neither Acergy S.A. nor Subsea 7 Inc. are directly or indirectly, owned or controlled by another corporation or by any
government. There are no arrangements known to either Acergy S.A. or Subsea 7 Inc., the operation of which may at a subsequent date result in a change in control of either Acergy S.A. nor Subsea 7 Inc. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The information on major shareholdings is compiled from publicly available information and data provided by third parties and accordingly neither Acergy
S.A. nor Subsea 7 Inc. is able to confirm the accuracy of this information (other than with respect to their respective ownership). Acergy S.A. is not able to determine the voting rights other than pursuant to the notifications received by Acergy
S.A. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>18.2.1 Acergy S.A. Major Shareholders </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Set forth below is information concerning the percentage of voting rights of all persons who held 5% or more of the issued share capital of Acergy S.A.,
as of August&nbsp;31, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

S.A.&#146;s Articles of Incorporation, it is Acergy S.A.&#146;s understanding that no single US owner represents more than 9.9% of its issued shares. </I></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>(c)</I></FONT></TD>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of August&nbsp;31, 2010, all of Acergy S.A.&#146;s 194,953,972 common shares were registered in the VPS, in the names of 4,100 shareholders. Excluding
issued shares registered in the name of Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas as depositary for the ADS, it is estimated that the free float of common shares on Oslo B&oslash;rs was 158,112,684 shares as of August&nbsp;31, 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At the close of business on August&nbsp;31, 2010, 184,154,877 Shares were outstanding, including those held through ADS. Of the issued Shares or share
equivalents 51,922,207 (28% of the voting rights) were held by 81 holders with registered addresses in the United States, including 25,459,193 held in the form of ADSs. Since certain of such Shares and ADS are held by nominees, the number of
identified holders may not be representative of the number of beneficial owners in the United States or the Shares held by them. </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All of Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s shares are registered in the VPS and the VPS register constitutes Subsea 7
Inc.&#146;s shareholder register. As of August&nbsp;31, 2010, Subsea 7 Inc.&#146;s 147,242,380 shares were registered in the names of 3,063 shareholders.&nbsp;Excluding shares held by Siem Industries Inc. and RBC CEES Trustee Limited (which is the
trustee of the Subsea 7 Employee Share Trust) it is estimated that the free float of shares on Oslo B&oslash;rs was 80,023,345 shares as of August&nbsp;31, 2010. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc59275_19"></A>XIX. TAXATION </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following summaries describe certain tax consequences relating to the acquisition, holding and disposition of Shares, ADSs or Scheme Shares in
certain jurisdictions. These summaries are intended to be general guidance and do not purport to be a comprehensive description of all of the tax considerations that may be relevant to any particular shareholder of the Issuer or of Subsea 7 Inc.
These summaries are not intended to be, nor should they be construed to be, legal or tax advice. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Each investor should consult their own
professional advisors with respect to the tax consequences of acquiring, holding and disposing of Shares, ADSs or Scheme Shares. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>19.1
Luxembourg </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>19.1.1 Luxembourg taxation </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following summary discusses certain Luxembourg tax considerations with respect to the Issuer and its Shares held by certain resident and non-resident
investors. This does not purport to be a comprehensive description of all of the tax considerations that may be relevant to any particular shareholder of the Issuer, and does not purport to include tax considerations that arise from rules of general
application or that are generally assumed to be known to the shareholders of the Issuer. It is not intended to be, nor should it be construed to be, legal or tax advice. This summary is based on Luxembourg laws and regulations as at the date of this
prospectus and is subject to any change in law or regulations or changes in interpretation or application thereof that may take effect after such date. Each investor should therefore consult their own professional advisors as to the effects of
state, local or foreign laws and regulations, including Luxembourg tax law and regulations, to which they may be subject. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>19.1.2 Luxembourg taxation of the Issuer </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Current tax status of the Issuer </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Issuer currently enjoys the special tax status granted to 1929 Luxembourg holding companies under the Luxembourg holding company Law, and the Grand
Ducal Decree of December&nbsp;17, 1938. These companies can carry out a limited number of activities, including the holding of shares and securities and the financing of affiliated companies. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As a 1929 Luxembourg holding company, the Issuer is not subject to any income tax, municipal tax, wealth tax or withholding tax in Luxembourg. The
contribution tax of 1% previously levied on issues of share capital was abolished on January&nbsp;1, 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Issuer is subject to a
variable tax rate, calculated annually with half-yearly advance payments, which is based on certain interest expense, dividends and certain compensation paid to non-resident directors during the period. These taxes are paid by the Issuer. The tax is
calculated as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Where the total interest paid each year to holders of bonds and other comparable debt securities amounts to or exceeds &#128;2.4 million: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3% on interest paid to holders of bonds and other comparable debt securities; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.8% on dividends and remuneration to non-resident directors on the first &#128;1.2 million; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">0.1% on any surplus dividends and remuneration to non-resident directors. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Where the total interest paid each year to holders of bonds and other comparable debt securities is less than &#128;2.4 million: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3% on interest paid to holders of bonds and other comparable debt securities; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3% on dividends and remuneration to non-resident directors, but to a maximum amount corresponding to the difference between &#128;2.4&nbsp;million and
the total interest paid to holders of bonds and other comparable debt securities; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="9%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.8% on any surplus dividends and remuneration to non-resident directors up to &#128;1.2&nbsp;million distributed; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
